sourceText: We spend a lot of time indoors with a young baby, and Covid-19 makes it much more intense.
text: We spend a lot of time indoors with a young baby, and Covid-19 makes it much more intense.

sourceText: It is completely normal to feel isolated, overwhelmed, anxious, and scared for you and your baby.
text: It is completely normal to feel isolated, overwhelmed, anxious, and scared for you and your baby.

sourceText: For more information click below links:
text: For more information click below links:

sourceText: Use social media, phone calls, and anything at your disposal to reach out and connect with others.
text: Use social media, phone calls, and anything at your disposal to reach out and connect with others.

sourceText: Take turns with others to care for your baby. Take time for YOU.
text: Take turns with others to care for your baby. Take time for YOU.

sourceText: Sleep when your baby sleeps so you have energy.
text: Sleep when your baby sleeps so you have energy.

sourceText: Sharing is caring.
text: Sharing is caring.

sourceText: Communicating with your baby.
text: Communicating with your baby.

sourceText: Follow your baby’s lead by copying or mirroring.
text: Follow your baby’s lead by copying or mirroring.

sourceText: Repeat and react to their babble or words.
text: Repeat and react to their babble or words.

sourceText: Use your child’s name when you speak to your baby.
text: Use your child’s name when you speak to your baby.

sourceText: Use words to describe what your baby is doing.
text: Use words to describe what your baby is doing.

sourceText: When babies cry.
text: When babies cry.

sourceText: Respond to your baby immediately.
text: Respond to your baby immediately.

sourceText: Check to see what is making your baby cry.
text: Check to see what is making your baby cry.

sourceText: Swaddling or gently rocking can help calm your baby.
text: Swaddling or gently rocking can help calm your baby.

sourceText: Singing a lullaby or playing soft music can be soothing.
text: Singing a lullaby or playing soft music can be soothing.

sourceText: Keep calm and take a break! You can place your baby in a safe place on their back, and then walk away. Be sure to check on your baby every 5 to 10 minutes.
text: Keep calm and take a break! You can place your baby in a safe place on their back, and then walk away. Be sure to check on your baby every 5 to 10 minutes.

sourceText: If you think your baby is injured or ill, call a health service provider or visit a clinic.
text: If you think your baby is injured or ill, call a health service provider or visit a clinic.

sourceText: Babies learn through play!
text: Babies learn through play!

sourceText: Get to your baby’s level and make sure they can see and hear you.
text: Get to your baby’s level and make sure they can see and hear you.

sourceText: Play peek-a-boo, sing songs or lullabies, stack blocks or cups.
text: Play peek-a-boo, sing songs or lullabies, stack blocks or cups.

sourceText: Make music together: banging on pots, playing with rattlers, shaking jars with beans.
text: Make music together: banging on pots, playing with rattlers, shaking jars with beans.

sourceText: Share books together - even at a very early age! Describe what is happening in the pictures. Let your baby explore books with all of the senses.
text: Share books together - even at a very early age! Describe what is happening in the pictures. Let your baby explore books with all of the senses.

sourceText: Learning with your baby.
text: Learning with your baby.

sourceText: Make their environment interesting!
text: Make their environment interesting!

sourceText: Babies respond to stimulation.
text: Babies respond to stimulation.

sourceText: Let your baby explore the world through the 5 senses!
text: Let your baby explore the world through the 5 senses!

sourceText: Be gentle with your children as they learn, but also with yourself as the parent!
text: Be gentle with your children as they learn, but also with yourself as the parent!

sourceText: Just because something didn’t go well today, or you lost your temper, this doesn’t define who you are as a parent.
text: Just because something didn’t go well today, or you lost your temper, this doesn’t define who you are as a parent.

sourceText: Remind yourself of the things you did well today, even if they may seem small.
text: Remind yourself of the things you did well today, even if they may seem small.

text: tips from UNICEF
